Kimikālā：A river near Jantugāma．Meghiya Thera was attracted by a mango-grove on its banks and asked the Buddha’s permission to meditate there．Twice the Buddha refused； the third time he gave his permission．Meghiya went，but soon returned，finding that he could not concentrate his mind there．The river was evidently in the neighbourhood of Cālikā （A．iv．354f； ThagA．i．149； Ud．iv．1）．



According to the Udāna Commentary （UdA．217），it was so called because it abounded in black worms （kālakimīnam bahulatāya）．v．l．Kipillikā．
